com.rcextract.minecord

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rcextract.minecord.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelGetter, SendableOptionsGetter, RecordManager<ServerEvent>

    public class Server
extends Object
implements RecordManager<ServerEvent>, ChannelGetter, SendableOptionsGetter
    In Minecord, a Server groups up a set of channels, usually by target or topic, and provides advanced settings and customizations for users to manage their channels easily.

    Both identifier and name are primary keys for developers and users to refer so they are unique. Identifier is unchangeable, name is changeable but must not be used by other servers.

    If approvement is true, players must be accepted to join the server. If invitation is true, player must be invited to join the server. If both are true, then the player must be invited to attempt to join the server. When attempting, the player must be accepted to join the server.

    If permanent is true, the server cannot be removed from the index in ServerManager.

    If locked, all players are kicked from the server and no one can join it. Only players with permission minecord.managelock.server can access, lock or unlock the server.

    A ChannelManager helps a server to manage channels, and a RankManager helps to manage ranks. They must stick to a server to work.

    A ServerRecordManager helps a server to manage records. It is separated into a class for merging purposes which feature will be provided in the future.

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
            throws IllegalStateException
        Unlocks the server. All functions should be enabled for normal users according to the rank manager. Only users with permission minecord.managelock.server should have access to unlocking.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException
